item.title: 特朗普敦促饼干桶恢复旧标识
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周二呼吁 Cracker Barrel Old Country Store 恢复其旧标识，对该餐饮公司正在进行的品牌改造努力进行了权衡，这一努力引发了反弹并打击了其股价。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday called on Cracker Barrel Old Country Store to go back to its old logo, weighing in on the restaurant company's ongoing effort to revamp its brand that triggered a backlash and hit its shares.】

item.title: 美联储的信誉是一种资产，其衰落可能代价高昂
item.description: 在 2021 年通胀飙升时，美联储可能迟迟没有加息，但在此期间对通胀预期的衡量显示，人们普遍认为物价会降温，这使得这场斗争变得更加容易，成本也更低，债券市场甚至在美国央行上调借贷成本之前就收紧了金融条件。【原文：The Federal Reserve may have been late raising interest rates as inflation surged in 2021, but measures of inflation expectations throughout that period showed broad belief that prices would cool, a fact that made the battle easier and less costly to wage, with bond markets even tightening financial conditions well before the U.S. central bank hiked borrowing costs.】

item.title: Trump Media 和 Crypto.com 宣布达成协议，成立加密货币金库公司
item.description: 特朗普媒体与科技集团（Trump Media & Technology Group）和 Crypto.com 表示，他们计划成立一家公司，实施一种宝库式的战略，以积累 Crypto.com 的原生代币--cronos，从而加深美国总统与加密货币行业的联系。【原文：Trump Media & Technology Group and Crypto.com have said they plan to launch a company that will implement a treasury-style strategy to accumulate Crypto.com's native token, cronos, deepening the U.S. president's ties to the crypto industry.】

item.title: 特朗普关税提高成本，美国卡车制造商寻找掩护
item.description: 特朗普政府的关税提高了价值 500 亿美元的美国重型卡车行业的制造成本，促使企业考虑从墨西哥采购更多零部件，以享受《美国-墨西哥-加拿大协定》（USMCA）的优惠政策。【原文：The Trump administration's tariffs have raised manufacturing costs for the $50 billion U.S. heavy-duty truck industry, prompting companies to consider sourcing more components from Mexico to benefit from concessions under the US-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA).】

item.title: Capital One-Discover 交易导致美国银行业利润下滑：美国联邦存款保险公司
item.description: 第二季度，Capital One 和 Discover Financial 完成合并，拖累了银行利润，银行业利润为 699 亿美元，比上一季度下降了 1%。【原文：The completed merger between Capital One and Discover Financial weighed down bank profits in the second quarter, as the sector reported $69.9 billion in profits, down 1% from the quarter prior.】

item.title: 据《信息报》报道，苹果公司内部讨论了收购 Mistral、Perplexity 的事宜
item.description: 据《信息报》周二援引知情人士的话报道，苹果公司内部已经就收购法国人工智能初创公司Mistral以及Perplexity举行了会谈。【原文：Apple has held talks internally about acquiring French AI startup Mistral as well as Perplexity, the Information reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 瑞安航空与 Booking.com 在长期法律纠纷后达成机票协议
item.description: 瑞安航空（Ryanair）周二表示，该公司已与 Booking Holdings 达成协议，允许其 Booking.com 和 KAYAK 网站转售瑞安航空的机票，这显然为双方在此问题上长达数年的法律纠纷划清了界线。【原文：Ryanair has struck a deal with Booking Holdings to let its Booking.com and KAYAK websites resell the airline's tickets, the companies said on Tuesday, apparently drawing a line under their years-long legal dispute over the issue.】

item.title: 金丝雀资本申请上市特朗普纪念币 ETF
item.description: 数字资产管理公司金丝雀资本（Canary Capital）周二申请上市一只交易所交易基金，该基金将跟踪美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的纪念币（名为 $TRUMP）的价格。【原文：Digital asset manager Canary Capital on Tuesday filed to list an exchange-traded fund that will track the price of U.S. President Donald Trump's meme coin, called $TRUMP.】

item.title: RTX 的普惠公司获得 28 亿美元的 F135 发动机合同
item.description: RTX 的普惠公司（Pratt & Whitney）周二表示，该公司获得了一份价值 28 亿美元的 F135 发动机生产合同。【原文：RTX's Pratt & Whitney has been awarded a $2.8 billion contract action for production of its F135 engines, the company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国商务部长表示，美国可能寻求分拆国防公司
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）周二为唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统推动联邦政府参股与其有业务往来的美国公司的做法辩护，称这一做法可能会进入国防工业。【原文：U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick on Tuesday defended President Donald Trump's push for the federal government to take stakes in U.S. companies it does business with, saying it could move into the defense industry.】

item.title: 英国德本汉姆斯集团预计上半年核心盈利将有所增长
item.description: 英国在线时尚零售商德本汉姆（Debenhams）集团周二表示，随着其扭亏为盈战略的推进，预计2026财年上半年持续经营业务的核心盈利将超过去年同期水平。【原文：British online fashion retailer Debenhams Group said on Tuesday it expects its first-half fiscal 2026 core earnings from continuing operations to exceed the year-ago levels, as it advances its turnaround strategy.】

item.title: 莫斯科法院以未遵守俄罗斯法律为由对谷歌处以罚款
item.description: 俄罗斯法院周二通过 Telegram 频道表示，谷歌因违反当地互联网法规被罚款 700 万卢布（约合 86,585 美元）。【原文：A Russian court has fined Google 7 million roubles ($86,585) for violating local internet regulations, the court said on Tuesday via its Telegram channel.】

item.title: 特朗普对美联储的举动动摇了央行独立的口号
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对美联储决策者的攻击正成为数十年来对中央银行独立性的最大威胁，而中央银行的独立性被广泛视为压低通胀和维持全球金融体系稳定的关键。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's attacks on Federal Reserve policymakers are emerging as the biggest threat in decades to central bank independence, which is widely seen as key to keeping down inflation and maintaining stability in the global financial system.】

item.title: 美国 7 月份核心资本货物订单和发货量激增
item.description: 7 月份，美国主要制成品资本货物的新订单增幅超过预期，表明第三季度企业设备支出有了一个强劲的开端。【原文：New orders for key U.S.-manufactured capital goods increased more than expected in July, suggesting business spending on equipment got off to a strong start in the third quarter.】

item.title: 公司备忘录显示，印度 TCS 任命阿米特-卡普尔为新成立的人工智能部门主管
item.description: 路透社周二看到的一份公司备忘录显示，印度 IT 公司塔塔咨询服务公司已任命阿米特-卡普尔（Amit Kapur）为新成立的人工智能和服务转型部门负责人。【原文：Indian IT firm Tata Consultancy Services has named Amit Kapur as the head of its newly formed AI and services transformation unit, a company memo seen by Reuters showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: MP 材料公司停止中国发货后，稀土价格达到两年来的峰值
item.description: 在美国矿商 MP Materials 因需求上升而停止向领先的磁铁制造商中国出口原材料之后，超强磁铁所需的两种稀土元素的价格飙升至两年多来的最高点。【原文：Prices of two rare earth elements needed for super-strong magnets have surged to their highest in more than two years after U.S. miner MP Materials stopped raw material exports to leading magnet maker China amid rising demand.】

item.title: 俄罗斯表示希望恢复与波音公司的钛合资企业
item.description: 俄罗斯第一副总理丹尼斯-曼图罗夫（Denis Manturov）在接受塔斯社采访时表示，俄罗斯希望在斯维尔德洛夫斯克州有波音公司参与的美俄合资企业能够恢复运营。【原文：Russia hopes that a U.S.-Russian joint venture involving Boeing in the Sverdlovsk region can resume its operations, Russian First Deputy Prime Minister Denis Manturov told the TASS state news agency in an interview.】

item.title: 新加坡吉宝公司就巴西腐败案向 Seatrium 公司索赔 5300 万美元
item.description: 新加坡吉宝（Keppel）公司周二表示，已对当地造船商 Seatrium 提起仲裁程序，要求赔偿与巴西打击腐败有关的 6840 万新元（5333 万美元）索赔。【原文：Singapore's Keppel has initiated arbitration proceedings against local shipbuilder Seatrium for a S$68.4 million ($53.33 million) claim related to a corruption crackdown in Brazil, the companies said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 法国流媒体用户在线死亡后，法国法院对 Kick 展开调查
item.description: 巴黎检察官周二表示，已对澳大利亚公司 Kick 展开初步调查，因为上周一名法国流媒体用户在该直播平台上死亡。【原文：The Paris prosecutor said on Tuesday it has opened a preliminary investigation into Australian-owned firm Kick following the online death of a French streamer on the livestreaming platform last week.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，Stellantis 因缩减软件规模而搁置三级驾驶辅助系统项目
item.description: Stellantis 公司的三位知情人士告诉路透社，由于成本高昂、技术难度大以及担心消费者的胃口，该公司已经搁置了首个 Level 3 高级驾驶辅助系统项目。【原文：Stellantis , has shelved its first Level 3 advanced driver-assistance program because of high costs, technological challenges and concerns about consumer appetite, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: Spotify 宣布为免费和高级用户提供消息功能
item.description: Spotify 技术公司周二表示，它将于本周开始向免费和高级订阅层级推出一项信息功能。【原文：Spotify Technology on Tuesday said it will start rolling out a messaging feature this week to both free and premium subscription tiers.】

item.title: 早间新闻美联储 "炒鱿鱼 "刺激神经
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: AT&T 将以 230 亿美元从 EchoStar 购买部分频谱许可证
item.description: AT&T 周二表示，它已同意以约 230 亿美元的价格从 EchoStar 收购某些无线频谱许可证，因为这家美国电信巨头正在扩大其网络规模，以便在竞争激烈的市场中保持领先地位。【原文：AT&T said on Tuesday it has agreed to purchase certain wireless spectrum licenses from EchoStar for about $23 billion, as the U.S. telecom giant scales its network to stay ahead in a competitive market.】

item.title: 特朗普抨击美联储主席库克，投资者震撼，期指下滑
item.description: 周二，美国股指期货下滑，受较长期国债收益率上升的打压，原因是唐纳德-特朗普总统解雇美联储理事的决定再次引发了市场对央行独立性的担忧。【原文：U.S. stock index futures slipped on Tuesday, pressured by a rise in longer-dated Treasury bond yields as President Donald Trump's decision to fire a Federal Reserve governor renewed concerns about the central bank's independence.】

item.title: 英伟达业绩凸显中美贸易战影响
item.description: 在与特朗普政府达成不寻常的协议以及中国政府随后努力阻止进口之后，英伟达这家人工智能芯片制造商周三公布财报时，其在中国的业务将成为投资者关注的焦点。【原文：Nvidia's business in China will be the focus of investors when the AI chipmaker reports earnings on Wednesday, following an unusual deal with the Trump administration and Beijing's subsequent efforts to stall imports.】

item.title: 期权显示，财报发布后英伟达股价将波动 2,600 亿美元
item.description: 美国期权市场数据显示，在芯片制造商英伟达（Nvidia）周三公布第二季度财报后，期权交易商对该公司市值约 2,600 亿美元的波动进行了定价。【原文：Options traders are pricing in about a $260 billion swing in Nvidia's market value following the chipmaker's second-quarter earnings expected on Wednesday, U.S. options market data showed.】

item.title: 德国法院认定 Apple Watch 不是 "二氧化碳中性产品
item.description: 本周二，德国一家法院作出支持环保人士的裁决，认定这家美国科技公司误导了消费者，苹果公司不能再在德国宣传其 Apple Watch 是 "二氧化碳中性产品"。【原文：Apple can no longer advertise its Apple Watch as a "CO2-neutral product" in Germany, following a court ruling on Tuesday that sided with environmentalists in finding that the U.S. tech company had misled consumers.】

item.title: 汇丰银行因信息披露失误被香港监管机构罚款 420 万美元
item.description: 香港监管机构周二表示，汇丰银行因信息披露失误被罚款 420 万港元（537,682.59 美元）。【原文：HSBC has been fined HK$4.2 million ($537,682.59) by Hong Kong regulators over disclosure failures, the regulators said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 印尼称美国同意对其棕榈油、可可和橡胶免征关税
item.description: 印尼首席关税谈判代表周二表示，美国已原则上同意印尼出口的可可、棕榈油和橡胶免受美国总统唐纳德-特朗普自8月7日起征收的19%的关税。【原文：The United States has agreed in principle to exempt Indonesian exports of cocoa, palm oil and rubber from President Donald Trump's tariff of 19% imposed since August 7, the Southeast Asian nation's chief tariff negotiator said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普对美联储的最新嘲讽引发的不安多于戏剧性
item.description: 周二，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普再次打击美联储的独立性之后，全球投资者大受打击，既担心政策政治化，又担心市场的回报。【原文：Global investors were shell-shocked on Tuesday after U.S. President Donald Trump struck another blow at the Federal Reserve's independence, caught between the concerns over politicisation of policy and the payoffs for markets.】
